definition: complete sexagenary cycle/a 60 year-old person/passage of time
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°

sentences.english: Well-operated investment distinguishes one from others between retiring in his 40's or his 60's.
sentences.chinese: 巧妙投資，你在不惑之年或花甲退休就會體會到區別。

sentences.english: A philosophy professor which was nearly a cycle of sixty years was having his last class.
sentences.chinese: 一位年近花甲的哲學教授在上他的最後一節課。

sentences.english: Although he is over sixty, but he insists on cleaning the house all by himself.
sentences.chinese: 雖然他年過花甲，但仍然堅持自己打掃屋子。

sentences.english: If you invest your money wisely, you will experience the difference between retiring in your 40's or your 60's.
sentences.chinese: 巧妙投資，你在不惑之年或花甲退休就會體會到區別。

sentences.english: All three authors are in or fast approaching their 60s.
sentences.chinese: 三位作者都已經接近或步入花甲之年。

definition: yi mein (or yee mee or yee-fu noodles etc), a variety of Cantonese egg noodle
without doubt/with full self-confidence/forty years of age
